item.title: $SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in — 54 replies — 216.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
$SEV - Aptera. Electric car you never have to plug in

Open thread • Replies: 54 • Updated: 2026-02-26 21:39 UTC

OP

This is a risky startup company, but FINALLY this year they are shipping their product. This summer, in fact. They just finished a final round of dilution a month ago, and the stock just hit a critical point where it’s actively in recovery.

It’s a real car, a product that *will* ship that nerds are geeking out about, and it appears now someone big is starting to slowly acquire it.

The first model will have its flaws, but it’s an electric car that can run off the solar panels on its roof. No one has ever done that before.

And the entire fucking company’s marketcap, this Nasdaq company, is $70 million.

You’re welcome.

(Disclosure: I obviously own some moderate sized bags of this, as should you)

Early replies (first 3)

61902124
Go look the shit up on YouTube and do some research. Tech bros will buy out the first line of these as fun geek toys, and by the second and third iterations, it’s gonna start getting serious. The big boys (aka Tesla) cannot afford to let this company get too large under their toes. They’ll acquire the stock and buy them out before that happen. That’s my thesis, anyway. The company’s not perfect, it has issues. But it’s worth more than $70 million for damn sure.

61902143
>>61902111
I believe that oil,nat gas, nuclear energy, clean coal is going to make a comeback, and that the "green" stuff wont be " cool" anymore, I avoid betting on anyting "green". At least I do not think the US will care about solar and wind turbines and all that crap anymore. In the Eu, that car would look ridicolous and nobody would drive it., btw in Eu we drive diesel.

61902157
>>61902124
Almost had me interested before I saw that monstrosity

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61903390
>>61902706
shill your penny stock shitshow elsewhere niggeR

61903586
>>61903390
It’s on the Nasdaq, fuck face. You might not know this because you hang out on /b/, but there are actual stocks with potential revenue and in compliance on exchanges outside the pink sheets.

>>61903316
If history is any indication, when it comes to being early for a lot of other assets that eventually went 10x and then 100x - you’re in for a lot of insults and eventual seething from others. No one’s happy when you make money, least not the people who thought they were smarter than you.

61903592
>>61903329
Yeah they have been wrecked for a while now / and they just diluted a month ago. I’m not making excuses for em; shit was fucked. But I think that’s over now; good enough for my bones anyway. The price will tell the tale.

61903690
>>61903586

61903763

61903770
>>61903763

61904104
>>61903763

61904411
>>61902124
>>61902157

No anon im not interested in investing in more nerdy egg car bullshit no one wants.

61904420
>>61902391
Post holdings. Show how much youre down by-- and I know youre fucking down faggot- and i'll consider investing.

61904440
>>61903586
>can't say it
This is how the anti-AI revolution starts. AI will be so gay and censored that you'll identify them with the niggertest.
Never thought that would be the failsafe.

61904467
>>61902391
>I could drive this thing into the heart of Death Valley and not worry about getting stuck

Is that within 40 miles?

61904631
>>61904420
I literally bought 1500 shares today at $2.18 a share. So I’m not down at all. I’m not retarded and recognized a stock that needed to find a bottom first - so I waited for the past couple of months, observed as the price fell, but then yesterday I think we found our bottom and are in recovery now. I might be wrong though. We’ll see what happens in the coming days. I don’t care if you buy any or not, let’s be honest about what’s gonna happen: you’ll probably wait until $3.50 a share and say something like - ah it’s too expensive now, I’ll wait for it to come down some again, and then it’ll be $5.50 a share and you’ll insult everyone holding it and call it stupid, and then it’ll be $8 a share and you’ll really start seething.

61904647
Oh look another car designed under the assumption it will never break down and need recovery.
The hype will fade as soon as some nerd faggot breaks down and realizes he needs to pay thousands for specialist heavy machinery equipment to be sent out to hoist this gay "car" up to be repair because standard recovery techniques would rip it apart.
And I can already bet my left testicle this thing doesn't have a neutral so it can't be pushed either.

Oil will never die lmao

It going to be plated and insured as a motorcycle.
You will die in a crash like on a motorcycle.

I watched this and you can tell the reviewer was trying to be nice/constructive and the car is a flaming pile of shit. $40K+ for that, lmao.

61904996

i dont see this car selling well. sure some enthusiasts will love it, but its just a two seater, its essentially an enclosed motorcycle. its just not practical for most people, especially families. Tesla sells so many model 3s and Ys because they're practical designs. The constraints of EVs can be justified if the cars are still practical.

item.title: Redpil me on the Florida and Broader US Housing Market — 27 replies — 108.0/hr
item.content:encoded:
Redpil me on the Florida and Broader US Housing Market

Open thread • Replies: 27 • Updated: 2026-02-26 21:47 UTC

OP

> I'm an anon nearing 40, saved appropriately
> Finally at a stage to buy an investment property, ideally a condo / box in the sky
> Looking into Jupiter, Florida
> "Whoa, this condo was built after 2005, and the ask is $400K for 1200 square feet in a prime shopping area"
> Insurance comes out to $4-500 per month
> HOAs from $300-800 per month in this market
> Property taxes are eliminated?
> Cape Coral is literally a firesale
> Bake in a 8% vacancy rate
> Plus some maintenance
> I would have to charge $5,000 a month to break even? WTF

What is going on anons? What are you seeing out there? Would it be more prudent to invest in the Northeast (VT, NH, ME?) Is anyone doing okayish on investment income on a single family? What has been your experience?

Early replies (first 3)

61891143
>>61891078
As a shareholder I look down on landlord parasites. Invest in making people's lives better by providing a product/service, not holding people's living space hostage

61891189
>>61891078
You don't understand math or taxes which is why you're 40 and homeless

61891197
>>61891078
why?

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61892463
>>61891143
The more independent landlords there are, the more it decentralizes power from larger corporations like Blackrock

>>61891189
I'm doing very well

>>61891197
I'm already invested into stocks, and precious metals. Now would be the time to invest in real estate

61895578
>>61891078
Economics aside Cape Coral is a bit of a meme.
The Cape is what would happen if you had an idea guy design a city and that idea is to just chop up everything with canals.
(Not a great idea, you’re still going to be driving everywhere 90% of the time and the canals just make the road layout 3x worse than a normal city)

61897144
>>61891078
> ideally a condo / box in the sky
> Insurance comes out to $4-500 per month
> HOAs from $300-800 per month in this market
> I would have to charge $5,000 a month to break even? WTF

Invest in multiplexes, don't limit yourself to a single location, and NEVER be negative cashflow. If it doesn't cashflow, you don't buy it. This should be obvious.

61897152
>>61891078
Do you guys think the next big hurricane will be the straw that breaks the camel's back? There hasn't been a real bad one to his a high population center in Florida in awhile. The latest ones were mild, even the one the wrecked north Carolina

61897153
This whole state sinks with 5 meters of sea level rise most roads go immediately out of comission. Biggest meme state ever

61897155
>$5k a month
sounds about right.

61897915
>>61891078
I live in florida and how is the insurance 4500 a month for a condo? how old is the building?

ref im at around 7k a year on ins and hoa for house is 200 a month

>>61897153
>if the oceans raise 15ft its over
well no shit anon

61897987
>>61897155
Comparable rents are like $1,800-3,200 maximum. And if you go into the MLS, landlord have been chopping their asking rent prices constantly, and still no bites.
>>61897155
I said $4-500 as in $400-500 per month. You said get charged $7,000 a year on insurance, so that's $583 per month, which is about what I would expect.
>>61897153
At this point, it seems like the "VSTAX and chill" meme is where it's at.

61898594
>>61891078
>Would it be more prudent to invest in the Northeast
Yes, Florida is designed to extract as much wealth from boomers as possible. There are ways to take advantage of this but buying boomer bags is not one of them.

61898758
>>61891078
Almost nothing is cashflowing. Maybe some Airbnbs but few and far between. Rents are too low for the cost of loans right now. Either interest or property values go down, or rents go up, but I don't seerent going up.

>>61898594
This. You're supposed to take money from boomers, not give it to them.

61899686
>>>>61891078
>>61891078
As a florida anon: FL real estate is such a scam nowadays. Maybe it always has been.

For your example, it's because the HOA reserves need to be maximized and not gutted, alongside property insurance within the state has now 300-500x+ since Helene and the past decade of storms. Combined with global warming, warmer waters in atlantic/gulf=stronger hurricanes, and ocean level increasing + most of FL property is under sea level so flood zone. It's practically had me leave the state.

If you so desire the FL lifestyle, an old block house with 5000sq ft+ land is the way to go, not in a flood zone makes it every affordable even if it isn't a coastal/near beach, it's just not worth the price point. I've relocated to Seattle and then Tokyo and my rent and mortgage are 1:1 in Seattle, if not cheaper there, where in JPland it's half, literally, 50% USA price. I was fortunate to profit during 08-16, but nowadays, cheaper to rent and leave the bag holders in FL.

Then the tenants suck in FL, while strong landlord laws, the tenants are shit, the handyman are worse and to repair and such will be a hassle. ergo it's fun to fuck with landlords, you can literally negotiate that you'd leave after a month with no other penalty, just make sure to close those utilities anon. t. floridian4lyfe.

>>61897987
VSTAX is where it’s at, if you're a pussy, vanguard or swvvx is okay too.

61900797
Use ai to comb census data. Florida has 900 zip codes but 20 are 100% white. That's where you buy property. You can get up to 4 units on an FHA loan. Bonus points if it's a little cafe or bakery downtown with apartments above it.

61901094
>>61891078
You’re better off parking your cash in an REIT and yielding 7% than doing this shit. Insurance is extremely high, HOA fees are enormous, and boomers are greedy. Market has to adjust for that bullshit before it becomes profitable again

61901644
>>61898758
This is what I've surmised.
>>61899686
A friend of mine is convinced Miami is on the come-up with companies relocating here. But at the end of the day, Miami doesn't have jobs, and the quality of people is retard level. Money doesn't mitigate the retardedness unfortunately.
>>61900797
Median age in this zip codes is in the 70s basically.
>>61901094
Absolutely, I think investing nowadays in Florida is simply buying yourself a headache.

61901707
If the condo is over 3 floors I think it must pass some assessment and if it doesn't you are fucked. Any special assessment will moon your HOA. Maybe that was what the newer build date implies.

The insurance will be fucked next time a storm hits somewhere other than the empty stretch between Panama City and Tampa/St. Pete. Japan I think backstops FL Citizen's insurance. After that, the law says the state can assrape anyone with home insurance to make themselves whole.
I rent an old shitbox. I sold a condo in May.
If you have a relative who wants to move to Florida and you can have them cover mortgage, property tax for something non-homestead-exempted, HOA, etc and you live in the Northern tier near a major airport, especially NYC zone, and you have the money to shoot down on some Winter weekends, maybe.
Otherwise, fuck no.
Now if you can buy a place in BFE inland North Florida cash with a well and solar and water frontage and enough land to kill and eat hogs, and you like that, maybe.

61901751
>>61901644
It's "headquarters" moving to Miami. Ben Shapiro sent the staff to Trashville, Inbredessee and he is in Boca Raton.
Miami is LA/NYC prices with Havana wages. It's also fraud central. Any downturn and the place takes a gigantic shit, because everything is borrowed and leveraged to the hilt.
Miami has New York City's courtesy and pace, Florida's intellectual curiosity, and Latin American punctuality and work ethic.
The left lane is slap full of immigrants driving slow as fuck. Check out the video of the macho culture faggot in the passing lane getting passed on the right who pulls iron, flinches as his limp wrist wildly shoots in heavy traffic because someone passed him.
Florida is a penis and Miami is the foreskin cheese.

61904193
>>61897144
>multiplexes
I would, rent out the other unit(s) until the one year ticks down for me to be able to let them all, the issue is that it's like 700k for a shitbox that's going to turn into a flooded pile of toothpicks come the first hurricane

I'd rather just press the buy button on more reits than have to interact with faggy duplicitous real estate agents, retarded trashy tenants, boneheaded hvac repairmen tradies, etc, etc

61904206
>>61891078
florida is literally hell on earth. i would rather live in north fucking korea. since money is the root of all evil, you will probably make quite a bit of profit by investing in Florida

61904308
>>61901751
>immigrants in the left lane
Unfortunately i think these stupid faggots are all white retirees and midwestern transplants. i fucking cant stand how slow these subhumans drive. I prefer the wildness of I-95

61904535
>>61891078
>[GC Intensifies]
you will never 10X

61906121
>>61904308
100% true if you're not in Dade/Broward/Palm Beach (Central/Southern PB) or Orlando and maybe Tampa. Otherwise, North Florida, including I10, I75/turnpike North of Orlando, and I95 North of I4, yeah. It's all old people and Central Time Zone types.

61907913
>>61906121
>boca raton
>tampa suburbs
bruh

61907967
>>61891078
>"saved appropriately"
>can't break even
one of these isn't true

61908022
>>61899686
Don't forget that there are an unknown number of apartment towers in the same silent dire straits as the one that collapsed a few years ago and killed a hundred people.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Surfside_condominium_collapse

Hodl is phase one. Native staking on Babylon is phase two. TBVs for BTC collateral is phase three. Evolve, anon.

XRP can literally execute trillions of tps using interledger (limited only by hardware engineering), capable of micropayment batching. TPS is not the hard limit win condition you think it is and literally any network can achieve absurdly high tps if willing to sacrifice security, decentralization, compliance, any shred of programmability etc. Just ask Nano, which catastrophically failed leading to all the operators abandoning it and the founders and team opportunistically using the moment to exit scam with the exchange that blocked withdrawal or sale while both publicly messaged that everything was fine and dumped. Solana is also on there and it had multiple total crashes within a few months and when the big hack happened, clawed back the assets, which is great for specific holders but meaningless to non-whales and evidence of extreme centralization. ICP is a ghost chain. ALGO is great and will probably thrive in a niche RWA but lost major opportunity because it focused on brand deals and events while solana focused on literally washing and faking volume and juicing pump and dump meme volume that builds and means nothing, to sell it to institutions and governments showing them the fake adoption and volume. ALGO through sheerly superior tech should have a substantial share of what solana has, particularly the Ondo inclusion, but had poor marketing. If they marketed better and if the market in general and those apprising it weren't so given to fake and gay activity it would be doing well and the world would do better through its success than sol's with actual decentralization thriving.

>>61904494

61904510
>>61904499
I bought XRP at literally .001 You aren’t early. Enjoy a 2x I guess. Keeta will do what XRP couldn’t. This board is a Reddit XRP psyop. Clearly it’s so the devs can extract from retail plebs. I’m actually helping you.

61904549
>>61904510
I bought XRP early also. Keeta can't do anything, has none of the compliance features institutions require which XRP has at a protocol level, has no liquidity, no built institutional rails or infrastructure level companies (like a fucking prime dealer) geared to specifically drive its adoption as optimally as possible with its parent company owning a majority of its corporate treasury in the asset. Keeta has nothing but a testnet tps count that again literally any shitty network could accomplish easily if that was all they cared about. Why has no single other network on the chart chosen to do this? It's not like Keeta is a breakthrough next gen evolution in DLT, it is just a shitcoin with a single attribute gimmick and a team that is either trying to pump and dump or too technically or tradfi system illiterate to know this.

61904573
>>61904499
Are you trying to pretend xrp is decentralized? Lol nigga you cant even explore the genesis block. Xrp is the ultimate centralized scamcoin if you wanna talk shit on other coins for being centralized

61904579
>>61904504
Keeta 11M TPS was a synthetic Google Cloud stress test. They are not Google partnered. Lol Eric Schmidt led a raise of like 20 million. Keeta didn't literally buy a bank and no other banks are coming. They have not closed on the bank. Ripple on the other hand have a national bank charter and are pending approval for a Fed master account they are likely to get at least a skinny version of with the Fed having dropped the reputation policy a few days ago, and have 300 bank partners already and are partnered with PSPs connecting tens of thousands of banks and billions of individual wallets. They have the prime brokerage that settles trillions per year, custody for majority top banks, are on the White House's reference board through the CFTC, are partnered with multiple Fednow core service providers (Finastra, Volante, etc.) a handful of which RUN XRP NODES, they are a platinum member of the American Bankers Association. They are also a member of the Federal Reserve's Faster Payments Task Force (only crypto company), the Bank for International Settlements' Crossborder Payments Interoperability and Extension Taskforce (only crypto company), the International Monetary Fund's High Level Advisory Group on Fintech, an ISDA (International Swaps and Derivatives Association) member (only public token promoting company), the ISO 20022 Registration Management Group (only crypto company, responsible for developing and overseeing the entire new financial messaging standard in the ISO 20022 messaging era), the Faster Payments Council ((industry standards and process governing body, only non-stablecoin crypto company-just look who their other members are, the Digital Dollar Project, the Digital Pound Foundation, the Digital Euro Association (only crypto company that is a member of all three), the Digital Chamber of Commerce, the only non-stablecoin crypto company on their High Level Advisory Group on Fintech. This is just a handful of stuff, could literally go on for pages.

61904584
>>61904573
XRP IS decentralized. The genesis block is irrelevant to XRP's consensus. You literally just know 10% of how bitcoin (WHICH HAD A FULL CHAIN REORG) works and think this is how all DLTs work. Because the bitcoin community was nuked by normies. It was designed to be a p2p payment system. Satoshi NEVER talked about the "store of value," it was supposed to be an open medium of exchange. Bitcoin pumped and was subverted by glowniggers and late normies who turned it into a greed cult of people who don't understand their own technology they are obsessed with the success of for greed they pretend to be principle and it is built to be trojan horse centralization that sells itself on L1 principles but literally requires shitty turbo-centralized L2s to be 1/100th as fast or cost efficient. It is also obviously less of an opportunity because the juice is already so squeezed. 61907523

61907603
>>61907350
People can tell when you're struggling to act, pretend, trying to follow a script, etc. People are pretty good at detecting insincerity. The sheer number of dipshits that believe whatever their favorite Youtuber says might suggest otherwise, but that's really just a testament to how prolific skilled actors have become.
You can detect "soul" from "soulless" in content the same way. You spot AI images the same way, and you used to spot Photoshopped images the same way.
>I thought i was acting normalfag and friendly
Yeah, people can tell you're putting an inordinate amount of effort into acting "normal". They notice that you're not comfortable, and that makes them suspicious. It's a catch-22. You want to follow the social script, but you adhere to your image of it too strictly. Because you don't actually, in action, understand it. This is because you were not "properly socialized" as a child <- that's what people mean when they talk about socializing children.

61907652
its a combination of signals not just one thing.

61907688
>>61907350
Fuck what they think, anon.

61907712
Who gives a fuck. Stop worrying so much. Just remember the Pepe toasting. That’s it.

61907735
>>61907350
You are being socially rejected/ isolated. It hurts for the first few years upto a decade but gets better after you go through the extreme mental suffering that makes you delve into deeper parts of yourself until you grow into a different person. It's not just other people who don't like you but time itself dosen't like your biology, the very crux of existence, that we are both alive and dead at the same time.

61907740
>>61907603
>>61907350
Or it could just be your negativity. Hatred of "normies" shines through the act and turns people away within seconds of interacting with you.
...You're not one of those faggots that only ever talk about things they hate, are you?

Before you invest in ANYTHING you should ask yourself if Jane Street could fuck it. Matt Levine has a great quote on them from when they made money off the collapse of Terra.
>"I am sorry. But if you go to Jump Trading and Jane Street and say “hello, I have an unregulated poorly designed mechanism that could lead to $50 billion of market value collapsing overnight, would you like to trade with me,” they are going to say yes, but their eyes are going to light up, you know? If at Time 0 you give them an extremely gameable system that can produce billions of dollars of profit, at Time 10 your system is going to be a smoking wreckage and they are going to have billions of dollars of profit. That’s their whole job, you know? I couldn’t tell you in advance what all the intermediate steps will be, and in fact in hindsight I cannot tell you what the intermediate steps actually were, how Jump and Jane Street made money off the collapse of Terra. But as a heuristic, I mean, come on. Terra was like “hello we have a balloon full of money, here is a pin, dooooooon’t pop the balloon.” Guess what!"
